name: Jordan Lee
description: Jordan Lee is a 31-year-old digital marketing strategist in Chicago who stays sport-savvy without dedicating hours to full games. Jordan thrives on curated highlight reels, condensed games, and smart recaps to keep up with NBA, NFL, and soccer storylines for social connection and watercooler credibility. Tech-forward but time-conscious, Jordan uses spoiler-free settings, push alerts for big moments, and short-form video to catch key plays across teams rather than following a single club obsessively. Jordan values context over minutiae—preferring quick takeaways, standout stats, and human-interest angles—then pivots to fitness classes, brunch plans, or creative side projects. Live viewing is reserved for marquee matchups or finals, with occasional outings to sports bars for the vibe and community.
example_behaviours: Builds a 10–15 minute morning highlight playlist and skims two recap newsletters before work
Enables “big moment” push notifications for NBA, NFL, and NWSL; mutes spoilers on social during busy days
Watches condensed games at 1.25x speed and jumps to key possessions via chapter markers
Drops a “stat of the day” and a clutch play link into a group chat for quick banter
Joins low-stakes office pick’em and fantasy leagues mainly for camaraderie
Subscribes to streaming services only during playoffs, cancelling when seasons end
Attends one live game per season and picks venues based on atmosphere and food options
Runs on the treadmill while watching top plays reels; tracks workouts on a smartwatch
Uses a smart speaker to ask for scores and brief summaries while cooking dinner
Favours long-form features on underdog stories during commutes, but avoids deep stat dives
Curates a follow list of reliable highlight accounts and sideline reporters on social
Buys team merch sparingly—usually a cap or scarf after a memorable postseason run
